hedline.hl1: GUARDIAN LIFE PLANS TO TAKE OVER BERKSHIRE LIFE

abstract.p: Guardian Life Insurance Co of America plans to take over Berkshire Life Insurance Co; there will be no exchange of cash in merger, but Guardian will assume responsibility for Berkshire's operations; Joseph D Sargent, chief executive of Guardian, will serve as chief executive of combined company, which will operate under Guardian name (S)

block.p: The Guardian Life Insurance Company of America, a New York insurer with $31.7 billion in assets under management, said yesterday that it planned to take over the Berkshire Life Insurance Company, based in Pittsfield, Mass., with $1.5 billion in assets under management. There will be no exchange of cash in the merger, but Guardian will assume responsibility for Berkshire's operations. Both companies are highly rated mutual insurers formally owned by their policyholders. Joseph D. Sargent, the chief executive of Guardian, will serve as the chief executive of the combined company, which will operate under the Guardian name.
